snippet: The Platters, with hits like “Only You” and “The Great Pretender,” were one of the first groups to be promoted across racial barriers. Mr. Reed was credited with naming the group in 1953.
abstract: Herb Reed, last surviving original member of the Platters, one of the first pop music groups to break the color barrier in the 1950s, dies at age 83. Photo (M)/
lead_paragraph: Herb Reed, the last surviving member of the Platters, one of the first pop groups to break the color barrier in the 1950s with crossover hits like ''Only You,'' ''The Great Pretender'' and a soaring street-corner version of ''Smoke Gets in Your Eyes,'' died on Monday in Boston. He was 83. The cause was lung disease, said his manager, Fred Balboni.

headline.main: Herb Reed, 83, Last of the Original Platters
